result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel O Silva was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • OWI (1st w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) [Modifiers: With a Minor Child in the Vehicle], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Mental health evaluation and treatment, if necessary.
No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  May have 3rd party contact to see the children.

Complete batterers intervention program.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.

records.addlTxt:
received and filed.
cab
Green assessment form blank. back to Court.
Count one/three  JOC, per review hrg on 9/22/16.
Count two, Fine/assessments were previously entered incorrectly.  Now corrected.

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court, in custody.  Katie Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Benjamin Lindsay.
cab
Agent in court.
The defendant has violated the no contact order a number of times and tested positive for alcohol.
The court gave the defendant an option to adjourn the case to make sure that the defendant has counsel here.  The defendant declined to have an attorney present and wanted to proceed.
The court ordered that the defendant serve 45 days condition time, with credit for 15 days.
Order signed and filed.
No future court dates set.

Defendant Daniel O Silva not in court.  Katherine M Halopka-Ivery appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Benjamin Lindsay.
The defendant was not produced from the House of Correction.  Case scheduled for another probation review hearing in branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for September 22, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Per the request of the probation agent, case calendared for a probation review hearing on 09/21/2016 at 08:30 a.m., Branch 36.
Bailiff in court instructed to have the defendant produced from the House of Correction.
cab

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court.  Patrick D. Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
   DOC agent also in court.
Defendant somewhat compliant but must do better.  If not agent to contact the court.
Associated with Charge #2

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Parties are in court for sentencing.
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.
As to count 2:
Court ordered the defendant to serve 75 days in the House of Correction, credit for 75 days.  Time served disposition.
Court ordered defendant to pay a fine of $350.00 plus all applicable costs and surcharges within 18 months, by 02/21/2017, or it is to convert to a civil judgment.
Court ordered defendant's operating privileges are revoked for a period of 1 year.
Court ordered defendant to obtain an alcohol assessment and cooperate with any treatment.
Defendant to have an interlocutory device on any vehicle he owns for 1 year.
.
As to counts 1 and 3:

  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 6 months in the House of Correction as to count 1 and 3 months consecutive to count 1 on count 3.   Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 20 months, concurrent probation,  with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; STAYED pending review.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Mental health evaluation and treatment, if necessary.
- AODA assessment; comply with any treatment.
- Maintain absolute sobriety; random urine screens.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by agent.  May have 3rd party contact fo see the children.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
- Pay DNA surcharge.
 
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36. 
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for November 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Received and filed:
Justice Point report.
cab

Turn over to Justice Point.
Defendant not to have any alcohol or drugs.  Defendant not to have any contact with the victim.

Bail motion argued and granted.  Court modified bail to $2,500.00 P.R. Bond with a turn over to Justice Point.
Defendant not to have any alcohol or drugs.  Defendant not to have any contact with the victim.

Plea hearing continued......
Amended information filed...
As to charge as amended:
Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant is advised he/she is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms. Defendant is advised he/she is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored. Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was/not ordered. 
The District Attorney has not complied with victim notification.
Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 36.
Defendant is requesting a bail review.
Jury trial date of 08/17/2015 is vacated.

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Daniel O Silva in custody.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Case was calendared for a final pretrial today.
The defendant wants to change his plea.
Plea hearing continued....
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Robert W. Buckett in court, defendant Daniel O Silva not in court, in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski for Ben Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial. Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 36.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Speedy trial demand.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court with attorney Robert W. Buckett.  Defendant Daniel O Silva in custody.  Dax Odom for Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Ryan Stuettgen-West Allis Police Department Officer.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 23.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Case spun to Preliminary Hearing Court.
Due to ADA assignment, case is transfered to branch 23.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE POINT for Supervision.
Court orders defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY and to be monitored by  portable breathalyzers. 
Court orders no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription. 
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Estrella C; Gary S; Elleya S; Elijah C.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Daniel O Silva in court with attorney Daryl A Kastenson.  Defendant Daniel O Silva in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. 
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Defendant pleads Not Guilty as to Count 2 and Count 3
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA has NOT been obtained from the Defendant. Court ordered the Milwaukee County Sheriffs  Department to obtain DNA from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
